meanings.definition: To clothe or adorn oneself in a new or different manner.
meanings.sent1: After the play, the actor will revest in his casual clothes.
meanings.sent2: She decided to revest in a beautiful gown for the party.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to revest in a costume but got tangled up in it.
meanings.sent4: The forest seemed to revest in a magical glow as the sun set.
meanings.sent5: The artist would revest her paintings with vibrant colors to make them stand out.

meanings.definition: To invest again with a former privilege or office.
meanings.sent1: The king chose to revest his loyal advisor with the title of Duke.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to revest the retired CEO with decision-making power.
meanings.sent3: The magician jokingly revested the rabbit with the ability to speak.
meanings.sent4: The old building seemed to revest with a sense of grandeur after the renovations.
meanings.sent5: The teacher would revest the student council members with their responsibilities each year.
